thread.section_title: Channel 5 addresses London terror attack as Neighbours airs Westminster car accident – Metro
thread.title: Channel 5 addresses London terror attack as Neighbours airs Westminster car accident
thread.title_full: Channel 5 addresses London terror attack as Neighbours airs Westminster car accident

author: Duncan Lindsay
title: Channel 5 addresses London terror attack as Neighbours airs Westminster car accident
text:
(Picture: Fremantle Media) Channel 5’s continuity announcer addressed yesterday’s tragic terrorist attack in London ahead of a second airing of a Neighbours episode which saw Toadie Rebecchi hit by a car in Westminster. 
The episode had already aired once, just around an hour before events unfolded in London which saw an attacker drive a vehicle into pedestrians on Westminster Bridge before then fatally stabbing police officer Keith Palmer.
When the episode aired again in the evening, the announcer reminded viewers that the scenes had been filmed months in advance. Nothing was cut from the episodes and Toadie’s injuries were minor.
(Picture: Fremantle Media) He had been hit by a taxi outside of his hotel and Karl Kennedy rushed to join his friend at St Thomas’ hospital. The real life tragedy yesterday, which saw 4 people killed, saw staff from St Thomas’ hospital rush out to Westminster Bridge to help those injured in the attack.
MORE: London Muslims raise thousands for victims of terror attack in Westminster 
MORE: Newspapers around the world report on terror in London
